storyInfo: The dialogue between the Laterans and the bishop comes to an end for the time being. Behind closed doors, the many conflicts within the monastery are about to come to a head.

attributes.content: In a place far, far away, there once was a village where the people led happy lives.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Some built homes to shelter the others from the elements, some reclaimed farmland.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Others set out to hunt, search for ores, and at the same time, fought back scoundrels who would take the village for themselves.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: No concept of ego existed among those villagers, no difference between self and other. No one could survive without the rest. They lived together in that small village, and called it home.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But, nothing good lasts forever. The soil yielded less and less, hunting become more and more difficult, and as food dwindled, stomachs grumbled in hunger.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The cold months crept closer and closer, but there was not enough fuel for heat...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Something had to be done about this! And so everyone said, 'this must be a trial given to us by the Lord, and we must pray for forgiveness!'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Just at that time, a group of well-meaning people came by, and upon seeing the plight of the village, spoke to the head of the villagers:
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: 'Come live with us in our city.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: 'But we can only bring those who are most like us.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: 'Come, and enjoy a better life. All you need to do is leave a few of you behind.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I don't like this story, Seniora Arturia!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Hmm? Why not?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Starving is really bad, it hurts!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Yeah, it's bad, and so is leaving your friends behind...
attributes.name: Shy Child

attributes.content: Yes, that is a very 'correct' idea of collectivism, with a little bit of heroism mixed in... or even romanticism.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Romantic stories do have ways of stirring the heart, but it is exactly that romanticism and high-mindedness that has a way of confounding others. Naturally, neither you nor I are immune.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ugh, big words... I don't get it at all...
attributes.name: Shy Child

attributes.content: You're talking like a weirdo again, Seniora Arturia!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Oh no, I'm sorry. That's my mistake.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Let's go with a different story then. What would you like to hear?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I wanna hear... a hero story!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: You all want to become heroes?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I wanna be a great hero! Just like Mamma!
attributes.name: Shy Child & Lively Child

attributes.content: Wow, your mamma sounds amazing!
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Be good now, and give me just a moment.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I seem to have caught you at a bad time. Am I interrupting you, Arturia?
attributes.name: Gentle Priest

attributes.content: You ask despite already knowing, Most Reverend Bishop Aulus.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Apologies. It was not my intent to displease you. I merely came to bid you farewell.
attributes.name: Aulus

attributes.content: Owing to the addition of an unexpected traveling companion, I plan to leave as soon as possible and escort my companion back home.
attributes.name: Aulus

attributes.content: Allow me to offer a prayer for this pitiful soul.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'm not trying to fight with you here...
attributes.name: Aulus

attributes.content: ...especially not in front of the children.
attributes.name: Aulus

attributes.content: However, 'pitiful' should never be used to describe one's resolve to live.
attributes.name: Aulus

attributes.content: Resolve, hm... resolve.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The amount of control we have over our own lives is often not as perfect as we believe it to be, and no one is ever the wiser until proven otherwise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Think of things that one must never do. They are often already done by the time their senses return to them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Does the act of blame contradict the heart's inner desires? Who is to say that our so-called resolve is not just a coping mechanism used to deceive ourselves?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: At times like these, where are our truest emotions and intentions hidden?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When will the day come that one's thoughts, emotions, and actions can truly be unified?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is this not the point of your inquiry, sir?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It seems that today is a in which a great many things will unfold. I hear a commotion outside, as if some acquaintances have come knocking.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If I were you, Bishop Aulus, I would not be in such a hurry to leave just yet.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Sorry to keep you waiting.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You took forever, Seniora Arturia!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: So slow...
attributes.name: Shy Child

attributes.content: Please forgive me. Why don't I tell an extra spectacular story to make up for it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Do you want to hear a story of a grand battle between heroes and villains?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I do, I do!
attributes.name: Shy Child & Lively Child

attributes.content: Alright. Then, you must listen carefully.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A long, long time ago in a faraway castle, there lived a young boy. The boy didn't express much emotion and rarely spoke, but he was incredibly fierce in a fight...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I told you I'm just a hunter. If that's not enough to satisfy you, then I don't mind trying something else.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I'm just an ordinary, roughly middle-aged Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I do not believe that is the entire truth.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That weapon behind you, you carry it always. You actively conceal your movements, which is a mercenary's habit.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's for self-defense.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You saw it yourself. Those bandits are always raiding us. Things aren't so peaceful here.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: That does not explain why you have a mercenary's habit.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I've got farm equipment in my hands more often than weapons these days.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I hunt for a living here. Sometimes, I work in the fields, or in the mines when I have to.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: No need to get all excited about these old hands of mine. I'm just an ordinary guy, bound up by life.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Federico, stay mindful of our mission here.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I don't think now's the time to be chasing hypotheticals.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: A reasonable determination.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Would Your Excellency mind explaining the situation?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Sorry to bring you trouble, Stefano.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: No, you have nothing to apologize for, Gerald.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: As the two of you might surmise...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Over a decade ago, Gerald brought a small group of Sarkaz to the monastery. At the time, they were stranded in the barrens, without food or ammunition.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: When they found our monastery, they had no choice but to try to make contact.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: You didn't expel them, so they chose to settle here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is there a difference between driving out those who've been cornered, and driving them into a corner yourself?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Er, I guess that makes sense...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: At first, not everyone was accepting of our new neighbors.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But rootless hatred and prejudice have no purchase when survival is at stake.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We provided a place for these people to stay, and in turn, they helped us deal with our own problems.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Our food shortage, the bandit threat, and our gradually depleting energy supply...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: They relied on us, so we also relied on them.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But you still chose to send Messengers to contact Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A choice made in the absence of choice...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Laterano is willing to provide us with assistance, and is also willing to welcome us back in.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: However, even Lemuen, the nuncio willing to grant us the most concessions, still held one non-negotiable condition
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: 'Sarkaz have no place in Paradise.'
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: No place? Why?!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: On the basis of race alone? Just because they are Sarkaz?!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: How are they any different from us? Without these stalwart brothers and sisters, we would've lost our fight for survival long ago!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Where was Laterano during all that time we were supporting each other?!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: So, let me beg the two of you, to once again
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Plead to the wisdom of His Holiness the Pope, and to your faith...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The haggard old man raises both his hands.
He both appears to be holding up his faith, as well as crumbling beneath its overwhelming weight.
The Sankta's faith is formless, intangible, nowhere to be found.
His fingers grasp for the halo above his head in vain, the old man's hands gradually slipping until they cover his face.
What Lemuen said is correct. There will not be Sarkaz in Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Nor will Laterano allow any Sarkaz through her gates.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hey, Federico, you don't have to be so blunt.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: This is a fact.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Enough, Stefano.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I already told you. We can accept it.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You go to Laterano, and we'll find a place to start over. That nuncio, Lemuen, promised us some support. But in name... we have to go our separate ways.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: It's always been a fact. The fact that they even offered us that much is already more than I expected. It's more than enough.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: No, it shouldn't be a fact! It's certainly not enough!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Don't get it? That we even nominally have to go our separate ways only makes this all the more ridiculous!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Sorry, Stefano.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: We've given up.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: What I mean is, you don't have to subject yourself to all this, just for our sake.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You don't need to be so hard on yourself.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I've talked to the others. We've decided... we're leaving.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: What are you saying...?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I assume that settles things, Reverend Executors?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: We'll leave. It just means letting go of a group of destitute refugees. You can do that, right?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: The Notarial Hall does not harm innocent civilians.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'm glad.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Really, Federico?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I do not lie.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Umm... How should I put this... Well, whatever. You're leading this operation, so if that's what you've decided, I don't object.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I swear to you, a Sarkaz has never been in a Lateran sacrarium.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: That in itself does not constitute a crime.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Really now?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: How should I say this... There's actually no explicit prohibition on it.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Bishop Stefano Torregrossa, I will continue to pursue the whereabouts of Oren Argiolas, based on your testimony.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: May I take it that you've accepted the conditions put forth by the Lateran, that all monastery residents, with the exception of the Sarkaz, will be resettled in Laterano at a later date?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If you remain silent, I will interpret that as your tacit consent.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Stefano.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Time...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I need a bit more time...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I would finish my final sermon, and spend one last night here.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Please... give me just a bit more time at the very end.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I will give you an answer after Matins tomorrow.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: What do you think, Federico?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Now, I wish to meet with Cardinal Aide Lemuen.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Seniora Lemuen is our guest. Of course you may visit her, if you wish.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In that case, we will take our leave... Hey, wait a second! At least say something first, Federico!
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Am I still holding onto some of my old merc habits?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Looks like even after all these years, some habits die hard.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Gerald, are you absolutely certain of this?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Sure, Stefano. You know I wouldn't joke around with this stuff.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: We're all bound by the need to survive.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: What you said was no lie.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Anyone home? I brought your winter clothes!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Huh, that's weird... Where is everybody today?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Fina? What are you doing standing around here?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Resident

attributes.content: Oh, Caroline! Perfect timing!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I came by to drop off everyone's winter clothes, but is something going on? I've been walking around all day and haven't seen a soul... What are you all busy with?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: We... have some stuff to take care of.
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: Thanks for coming all the way out here, but we're fine with what we have. Err, we already have enough winter clothes, so you can take these back. Also, tell the others not to worry about us.
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: What are you talking about? When in the last few years have any of us had enough to get through the winter?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Aren't you still wearing that light coat, Caroline? The temperature's going to drop pretty soon, so we need to get you into something a bit thicker...
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Fina, is something wrong?
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: What's that in your hand?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Oh... It's nothing. Just some hardtack.
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: No, let me see it!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Hey, wait!
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: The Sankta girl reaches out to snatch the supposed hardtack from behind the other girl's back. Almost instinctively, she splits the dry, hard thing down the middle before she is pushed away.
Stuffed inside the hardtack are truths hidden away all this time, finally exposed to her eyes.
What... is this?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Bran... and sawdust?!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Caroline?!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Didn't you say you had more than enough food? Then... why are you eating this?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: No, Fina, listen to me. We, we're just...
attributes.name: Caroline

attributes.content: Just what?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Talk to me, Caroline.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Tell me... What depths have we stooped to these days?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Knock.
Knock. Knock, knock. Knock, knock, knock.
The sound of knuckles rapping at the door.
The door isn't actually locked, but the guests outside still continue to knock and wait for a response.
This used to be a secret code agreed upon by several friends from school. So much time has passed that Lemuen thought she forgot, but the facts prove that she has not forgotten.
The meaning of the code words tapped by the guests is:
'Rescue successful.'
And: 'First arrival.'
Come in.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Salve, room service.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Gratias, please put the food over there on the table. Do you need a tip?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You can't just ask if you need to tip. It's gotta come from the heart, right?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Hmm, I guess you have a point.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You don't seem surprised at all, Lemuen.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Are you disappointed that it's me?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The fact that you're here means news of this place has already reached Laterano, right?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Hmm? Well, more or less. That Oren guy actually left you behind and ran off by himself. When I get back, I'm going to tell Mostima and Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Ahaha. Cut him some slack, won't you?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Booooo...
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Alright then, back to business. I know His Holiness wouldn't send you here alone, which means...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I need you to report your mission, as well as who's with you.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Switched to your business voice, huh? Alright then, Cardinal Aide Lemuen.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: This mission was commissioned directly by His Holiness and is led by Federico, executor of the Notarial Hall. The other functionary is Richele Colombo, another executor who volunteered to come.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Our first objective is to locate you and Oren, and the second is to investigate this monastery.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Oh right, Federico also has another mission to maintain order. Unfortunately, I think His Holiness picked the wrong guy for the job this time.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: And that concludes my report.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Mmhmm... I see. So, His Holiness actually sent that Federico, huh...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Okay. I get the gist of things. Gratias, Ria.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Again with the nicknames... C'mon, you should know better.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: So, what are you going to do next? On the surface, it looks like your movements are being restricted, but in fact, it's you who doesn't want to leave, right?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: If you wanted to leave, nobody here could stop you.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: My legs aren't fully healed yet.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Like that makes a difference.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: You trust me too much, Ria, though I suppose that's fine... Alright. It's true that I decided to stay behind.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: If Federico is trying to arrest the bishop here on charges of false imprisonment, I'd appreciate it if you could clear up the situation for me.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Also, sorry... But I don't plan on leaving just yet.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Mind if I ask why?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: The reason... Hmm. Let's just say that diplomacy isn't something that can be settled with guns and bullets alone.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: When it comes to a shootout, the odds are always in my favor. But if I have to sit down for a negotiation, I need to tread carefully or I might end up persuaded by the other party.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: It just so happens that I get along quite well with the residents here, so I want to see who ends up changing their mind first.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Oh? When you put it that way, it sounds like you plan on compromising.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Back in school, you watched me for an entire year just to make sure I showed up to class!
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Heehee. I thought it'd be a shame if you couldn't get your diploma for attendance reasons.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: As for the problem we have here... I still have a friendly attitude at least, right?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I knew Oren would report the situation here, which is why I chose to stay behind. I've had a bad feeling about it, and I don't want to provoke the bishop any further...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: With all the information I have on the monastery now, if there ever arises another opportunity to sit down at the negotiation table, I may be able to get him to relax a little and accept my proposal.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: *sigh*. I thought you'd say as much.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: I'm glad you understand.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That's not what I said.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: But that's what you're thinking.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I kinda hate empathy sometimes.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Now now, don't talk like that. How much do you know about the situation here?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Enough.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Nothing special about it other than the group of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Did you know they sent a total of three Messengers?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: ...Lia.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: I had the impression that you've never liked field missions. What made you sign up for this one?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Maybe that I wanted to see you?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Liar, liar~
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Anyway, I'll find the others and explain your situation first.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: But to be entirely honest, I don't think what you're doing here is going to accomplish anything.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: ...It's worth a shot.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: *sigh*, you're getting scarier and scarier, Lemuen.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Not like it matters, though...
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Finally mustered the means to reach out to me?
attributes.name: Familiar Male Voice

attributes.content: Here I thought you'd abandon the mission after seeing Lemuen.
attributes.name: Familiar Male Voice

attributes.content: Who knows, might not work out.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: No joke, please. Spare me.
attributes.name: Familiar Male Voice

attributes.content: You brought it up.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Alright, I don't have time to chat either. Let's talk business.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Phew... Dealing with guys like him really wears you down...
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: What a pain in the ass, this mission. Never would've taken it, if I knew.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Huh? Who's there?!
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Woah, didn't think you'd actually follow me, girly.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: I, I can't have you running around the monastery by yourself! I need to keep an eye on you to make sure you don't do anything bad!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: And, uh...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: There's also a favor I'd like to ask of you... and of course I'll pay you back for it!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Um, let's see...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Flour, eggs...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: And, uh... Where's the leftover sugar from last time...?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Ugh, I've been trying so hard to scrounge up leftover ingredients from dinner ever day, so why is there still so little?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: I need enough for Serpilia, Avus Stefano, Fina, and Raimund... And also, Patruus Gerald, Patruus Clment, Seniora Caroline, and...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: There's not going to be enough though.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Tuna?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I'm coming in, okay? There's something I have to tell you... What are you doing in here?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Oh, Fina! I was just about to go look for you!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Do you still remember when I helped Amita Nina with farm work for a month? Where did I put that bit of white sugar I got in return?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: How long ago was that? Where are you going now?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: What do you need sugar for? And, where'd you get all those cooking ingredients?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Wait, Tuna... Don't tell me you're still trying to bake sweets, at a time like this...?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Um, Fina, what's wrong? Are you... mad at me?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: I wasn't trying to hide food from you! I just wanted to prepare a surprise for everyone. Fina, don't be mad at me, okay? I promise you'll be the first to have some after I'm done!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Tuna, you... Forget it, just put those things down. Now's not the time to be doing stuff like this!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Huh? But...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: But what?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: But, I promised someone I'd make a herb pizzella as a gift...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: ...A gift?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Yeah! She helped fix up my patron firearm, so I have to thank her!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: It's like a miracle, Fina! Once this gun got fixed, I felt something different about it just holding it in my hands! It's like... like I knew how to use it from birth!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Look! It's even prettier now, and the two of us will be able to use it together from now on!
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: You know what, Tuna...?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I actually never cared that much about my own firearm. Or for Avus Stefano's sermons.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I don't even care that I've never seen Laterano.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Fina, what are you talking about?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Can I even really be called a Sankta?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Maybe I can.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: But, I care about you, and Raimund, and Avus Stefano and Patruus Gerald. And Patruus Clment, Amita Nina, Caroline...
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I care about everyone here. This is my only home, and they are my only family.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Fina? Of course I care about everyone else, just like you
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: No, it's not the same!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: If you were just like me...
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: If you knew how hard Raimund and the others have it, then you wouldn't be in the mood to make your joke of a pizzella at a time like this! You wouldn't be so nave!
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: I kinda feel like you changed after those people from Laterano showed up.
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Huh? Of course I haven't...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Tuna, that gun of yours... Was Lemuen the Lateran who fixed it up for you?
attributes.name: Delfina

attributes.content: Your Excellency, I've allowed the two visitors freedom of movement around the monastery, as you ordered.
attributes.name: Clment

attributes.content: But, are you sure it's alright? You... You don't look too good. Do you want to get some rest first?
attributes.name: Clment

attributes.content: Oh, Clment, it's nothing you need to worry about.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Go ring the bell. This week's sermon is being moved to today, so go tell the others...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Gerald, are you and your people coming?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Sorry, Stefano. We still have a lot to prepare. I can't say how many of us will show.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Clment

attributes.content: Are we seriously going to accept their terms? Do we absolutely have to leave behind our own?
attributes.name: Clment

attributes.content: Enough.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Go, Clment. Hurry.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Clment

attributes.content: If faith has betrayed itself, then I, too, must make my decision...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I must repent.
attributes.name: Abbot
